en_results_raw: I received a glass of ale, which I savored slowly, feeling the warmth spread through me. The mews was a quiet place, filled with the soft snorts of horses and the occasional creak of leather. I chatted with the ostlers, learning about the horses they cared for, their temperaments, and the long rides they often took. The sun was beginning to set, casting a golden hue over the cobblestones. As I finished my ale, I thanked the ostlers for their hospitality and promised to return. The evening air was cool, and I made my way back up the lane, feeling a sense of contentment. The garden, now bathed in twilight, seemed to whisper secrets of the day that had passed. I couldn't help but smile, knowing that this small moment of connection had enriched my day in ways that words could hardly describe.

Decidí sentarme a contemplar el paisaje, y fue entonces cuando noté un viejo libro escondido detrás de una de las columnas. Lo saqué y comencé a hojearlo, sorprendido al descubrir que era una antigua guía de la ciudad. Algunas de las descripciones coincidían con el lugar en el que me encontraba, lo que me hizo preguntarme si este libro había pertenecido a algún visitante anterior. A medida que el sol comenzaba a declinar, decidí regresar a la casa, llevando consigo el libro como un recuerdo de mi aventura. Antes de irme, me despedí de los mozos de cuadra, agradeciéndoles de nuevo por su amabilidad. Esa noche, mientras cenaba, no podía dejar de pensar en el misterio que el libro y el jardín guardaban.

es_results_raw: Al entrar en la iglesia, sentí un profundo silencio que me envolvió, como si el lugar estuviera suspendido en el tiempo. Los dos individuos que había seguido estaban de pie frente al altar, sus rostros inexpresivos, mientras el clérigo les susurraba algo al oído. No pude evitar preguntarme qué era lo que habían hecho para estar allí. El clérigo, un anciano de barba blanca, se giró hacia mí y me miró fijamente, sus ojos penetrantes parecían atravesar mi alma. "¿Qué buscas aquí, hijo?" preguntó con una voz que resonó en mis entrañas. No sabía qué responder, así que simplemente me quedé en silencio, observando cómo el clérigo se acercaba lentamente. "El perdón," respondió él por mí, "es lo que todos buscan aquí." Me di cuenta de que no era la primera vez que alguien había cometido errores, y que quizás yo también estaba buscando algo que no podía encontrar. El clérigo me guió hacia un rincón de la iglesia, donde una luz tenue iluminaba una pequeña estatua de un santo. "El perdón no es algo que se obtiene, sino algo que se da," me dijo. "Pero, ¿y si no merezco perdón?" pregunté, sintiendo una mezcla de esperanza y desesperación. "El perdón no depende de la merecida, sino de la compasión," respondió el clérigo, su voz calmada y serena. Pasé el resto de la tarde en la iglesia, reflexionando sobre las palabras del clérigo y sobre mi propia vida. Cuando salí, el sol ya se había puesto, y el taxi y el landó con sus caballos estaban aún allí, como si nunca se hubieran movido.

Los espectadores, confundidos y aterrorizados, comenzaron a correr en todas direcciones, algunos cayendo en el piso mientras trataban de escapar. Holmes, sin embargo, se levantó lentamente del sofá y se acercó a la ventana, mirando hacia afuera. La multitud, que había salido a la calle, gritaba y se agolpaba, creyendo que un incendio había comenzado en la casa. Holmes, con una sonrisa misteriosa, se dirigió hacia la puerta, seguido por la criada que intentaba explicar lo que había ocurrido. "Es solo un experimento, señora", dijo Holmes, mientras se dirigía hacia la salida. "No se preocupe, todo está bajo control". La criada, sin embargo, no parecía convencida, y siguió a Holmes, preguntándose qué otro experimento podría estar tramando.

en_results_raw: Mr. Wilson paused, his voice trailing off as he shook his head. "I suppose it's his way of coping," he muttered, though the words seemed more to himself than to the silent room. "He's always been a bit of a dreamer, lost in his own world. But I can't help but admire his dedication, even if it does lead him astray sometimes. I just hope he finds a balance one day, before it's too late." The room fell silent once more, the only sound the ticking of the old grandfather clock in the corner. Mr. Wilson sighed, his eyes distant as he gazed out the window, lost in thought. It was a quiet evening, and the world outside seemed to hold its breath, waiting for something to happen, though nothing did.

The light was flickering, as if someone was trying to signal me from the window. My curiosity piqued, I approached the window, only to find no one there. The light, however, continued to flicker, and I felt an inexplicable sense of dread. I knew I had to investigate, but I also knew that whatever was happening was beyond my usual understanding. Mr. Holmes, I implore you, help me unravel this mystery before it consumes me entirely.”

Hội mà ông sáng lập có mục tiêu hỗ trợ các dự án phi lợi nhuận và thúc đẩy sự sáng tạo. Nhiều người tin rằng Ezekiah đã truyền cảm hứng cho những người trẻ muốn theo đuổi đam mê phi thường của mình. Tuy nhiên, cũng có những ý kiến trái chiều cho rằng ông chỉ là một người thích tạo ấn tượng và thu hút sự chú ý. Mặc dù vậy, không ai có thể phủ nhận rằng Ezekiah Hopkins đã để lại dấu ấn mạnh mẽ trong cộng đồng phi lợi nhuận và những người theo đuổi sự phi thường.

Sin embargo, el detective no podía dejar de preguntarse qué tipo de personas acudían a estos préstamos nocturnos. Era evidente que muchos de ellos estaban en apuros económicos, pero había algo más detrás de sus rostros desesperados. ¿Qué secretos ocultaban sus mentes? Holmes decidió seguir investigando, no solo para resolver el misterio, sino también para ayudar a aquellos que estaban atrapados en una red de deudas. En las noches siguientes, siguió a varios individuos, notando cómo se reunían en lugares oscuros y solitarios. Era como si estuvieran esperando algo, o a alguien. ¿Qué papel jugaban en todo esto? Holmes sabía que la respuesta estaba cerca, pero necesitaría más tiempo y paciencia para descubrirla.

en_results_raw: After a few days, a letter arrived, but it was not the help I had hoped for. It was a formal notice from the authorities, informing me that my application had been denied. My assistant, who seemed so confident earlier, could only shrug his shoulders. "I told you to wait," he said, his voice laced with a hint of regret. "But what else could I have done? I had no control over the outcome." The news hit me hard, and I found myself walking aimlessly around the square, the letter clutched in my hand. The once bustling streets now felt empty, and I couldn't shake the feeling that I had made a mistake. Days turned into weeks, and I found myself revisiting the same spots, hoping for a sign or a change in fortune. The silence of the square, once a place of comfort, now felt like a reminder of my failure. I couldn't help but wonder if I should have taken matters into my own hands, but the thought was quickly dismissed. The letter remained a constant presence, a silent witness to my disappointment.

Holmes, ever the master of his craft, moved with quiet precision, his hands steady as he felt around the perimeter of the room. The lantern's glow returned, casting long shadows that danced across the walls. "We are not alone," Holmes whispered, his voice low and tense. "There is someone else here, someone who knows we are here." The tension in the air was palpable, every sound magnified. The faintest rustle of fabric, the softest creak of the floor, seemed to reverberate through the entire structure. My mind raced, trying to piece together what we were up against. The revolver in my hand felt both a comfort and a burden, its weight grounding me in the present moment. We waited, each second stretching into an eternity, the darkness a living entity all around us.

en_second_half: that, for he said that when I wrote them they seemed to come from me, but when they were typewritten he always felt that the machine had come between us. That will just show you how fond he was of me, Mr. Holmes, and the little things that he would think of.”

As I typed each letter, I felt a strange mix of excitement and curiosity about the person who had prompted such a reaction from him. The task was meticulous, and I found myself lost in the rhythm of the typewriter keys, each letter a small step towards understanding the mystery behind his actions.

Sin embargo, cuando finalmente las recogió, noté que había añadido pequeños detalles que no estaban en las originales. Me pregunté si había decidido hacerse pasar por ella o si simplemente quería que las cartas fueran más... románticas. Desde entonces, cada vez que visito la Oficina de Correos de Leadenhall Street, no puedo evitar pensar en esa tarde y en lo que podría haber significado todo aquello. A veces, me pregunto si alguna vez se enteró de que yo había sido quien las escribía. Aunque nunca lo mencionó, siempre me pareció que había algo más detrás de todo esto, algo que nunca logré descifrar. En retrospectiva, me pregunto si no fue un error ayudarlo, pero también me pregunto si no fue precisamente por eso que lo hice.

He preferred the quiet of the evening, where he could walk without drawing too much attention to himself. His illness had left him with a persistent cough and a hoarse voice, which he tried to mask with his gentle tone. Despite his shyness, he was a man of deep intellect and wisdom, often sharing his thoughts on philosophy and literature during our walks. His demeanor was one of quiet dignity, and I found myself drawn to his company, despite our initial meeting under rather unusual circumstances. It was clear that his past experiences had shaped him into a man of great sensitivity and introspection. His story was one of resilience, and I found myself not only a listener but also a confidant, as we delved deeper into the mysteries of life and human nature.

es_results_raw: Era un hombre muy tímido, señor Holmes. Prefería pasear conmigo por la noche que a la luz del día, porque decía que odiaba llamar la atención. Era muy reservado y caballeroso. Aunque su timidez era una parte importante de su personalidad, también tenía un lado valiente y decidido que lo hacía un verdadero héroe en mis ojos.

en_results_raw: Sherlock Holmes sat silent for a few minutes with his fingertips still pressed together, his legs stretched out in front of him, and his gaze directed upward to the ceiling. Then he took down from the rack the old, dusty magnifying glass, its surface etched with years of use. His eyes sparkled with a familiar intensity as he began to examine the intricate patterns on the glass. The room was filled with the faint scent of pipe tobacco and the soft hum of the city outside. His mind raced, already formulating theories and possibilities. The case that had eluded him for so long was about to take a new turn. He could feel it in the air, a mixture of anticipation and excitement. The magnifying glass in his hand felt like a lifeline, a tool that would help him unravel the mystery. As he turned it over in his fingers, he noticed a faint scratch that hadn't been there before, a clue perhaps, hidden in plain sight. The world outside the window seemed to blur as he lost himself in the puzzle, his thoughts a whirlwind of deduction and logic.

"Watson," dedi, "bana bu olayda ne düşünüyorsun?" Dr. Watson, omuz silkti ve cevap vermeden önce kısa bir süre düşündü. "Holmes," başladı, "bu durumda en önemli şey, her detayı incelemektir." Holmes başını sallad ve gözlerini dikkatle Dr. Watson'a dikti. "Ama Watson," dedi, "her detay, sadece detay değildir. Her şey bir araya gelir, sadece doğru yolda ilerlememiz gerekiyor." Dr. Watson, Holmes'un gözlerini izledi ve ona dikkatlice baktı. "O zaman, Holmes," dedi, "bana bu olayda ne düşünüyorsun?" Holmes, ellerini kavuşturdu ve tekrar tavana baktı. "Bu, sadece başlangıç," dedi. "Bir şeylerin altını keşfetmek için, her şeyi anlamamız gerekiyor." Dr. Watson, Holmes'un sözlerine dikkatle kulak verdi ve ona biraz daha güvenmeye başladı.

Holmes apoyó los pies en la esquina de la mesa y cruzó los brazos, observando en silencio a su amigo. Había algo en la habitación que parecía inquietarle, un silencio denso que se extendía como una sombra sobre la estancia. La luz de la lámpara se movía suavemente, proyectando sombras danzantes en las paredes. Era evidente que ambos estaban esperando algo, pero no estaban seguros de qué. Después de un largo momento, Holmes habló, su voz suave pero firme: "¿Qué te sucede, amigo mío? Pareces... distante." El hombre levantó la cabeza, sus ojos reflejaban una mezcla de confusión y tristeza. "No lo sé, Holmes. Es solo... todo esto es demasiado." Holmes asintió, comprensivo, mientras se levantaba y se acercaba a su amigo, poniéndole una mano en el hombro. "Tienes que confiar en mí, amigo. Juntos, resolveremos esto." El hombre suspiró profundamente, pero parecía encontrar algo de consuelo en la presencia de su mentor.

The daughter was of a good, amiable disposition, but affectionate and warm-hearted in her ways, so that it was evident that with her fair personal advantages, and her little income, she would not be allowed to remain single long. Now her marriage would mean, of course, the loss of a hundred a year, so what does her stepfather do to prevent it? He takes the obvious course
en_second_half: of keeping her at home and forbidding her to seek the company of people of her own age. But soon he found that that would not answer forever. She became restive, insisted upon her rights, and finally announced her positive intention of going to a certain ball. What does her clever stepfather do then? He conceives an idea more creditable to his head than to his heart. With the connivance and assistance of his wife he disguised himself, covered those keen eyes with tinted glasses, masked the face with a moustache and a pair of bushy whiskers, sunk that clear voice into an insinuating whisper, and doubly secure on account of the girl’s short sight, he appears as Mr. Hosmer Angel, and keeps off other lovers by making love himself.”

La hija era de buena disposición, afable, pero cariñosa y afectuosa a su manera, de modo que era evidente que con sus buenas ventajas personales y sus escasos ingresos, no se le permitiría permanecer soltera por mucho tiempo. Ahora bien, su matrimonio significaría, por supuesto, la pérdida de cien dólares al año, así que ¿qué hace su padrastro para evitarlo? Toma la medida obvia de mantenerla en casa y prohibirle

You see all these isolated facts, together with many minor ones, all pointed in the same direction.”

en_results_raw: Mr. Hosmer Angel's actions had always been shrouded in mystery, and the townspeople could only speculate on the true nature of his intentions. The stepfather, on the other hand, seemed to thrive on the attention and the whispers that followed the unusual occurrences. It was as if the stepfather had orchestrated the entire situation, using Mr. Angel as a pawn in some grand, yet unseen game. The townspeople, divided in their opinions, found themselves torn between suspicion and admiration. Some believed the stepfather was a master manipulator, while others thought he was merely a victim of circumstances. The truth, however, remained elusive, and the mystery only deepened with each passing day. The townspeople found themselves in a constant state of unease, always watching, always waiting for the next twist in the tale. The silence that enveloped the town was palpable, a heavy weight that seemed to press down on everyone. And so, the story of Mr. Hosmer Angel and the stepfather continued to unfold, each day bringing new questions and no answers, leaving the townspeople to wonder what dark secrets lay beneath the surface of their seemingly ordinary lives.
vi_first_half: “À, tất nhiên rồi, điều dễ dàng nhận thấy ngay từ đầu là anh chàng Hosmer Angel hành động kì quặc như thế là có mục đích, và cũng rất rõ ràng là đối tượng duy nhất thực sự được hưởng lợi từ sự việc này, như chúng ta có thể thấy, chính là người cha dượng. Tiếp theo là đến chi tiết hai người đàn ông này chưa bao giờ xuất hiện cùng lúc, chính việc một người luôn luôn xuất hiện khi kẻ kia đi vắng đã nói lên rất nhiều điều. Cặp kính râm và giọng nói lạ lùng cũng thế, cả hai
vi_second_half: đều gợi ý đến một sự ngụy trang, cũng giống như bộ râu quai nón rậm rạp. es_results_raw: Bien, para acabar con el asunto, señor Holmes, y para no abusar de su paciencia, hubo una noche en la que hizo una de esas salidas de borrachera de las que nunca volvió. Cuando fuimos a buscarlo, lo encontramos boca abajo en un pequeño estanque cubierto de espuma verde que había al pie del jardín. No había señales de violencia y el agua no tenía más que medio metro de profundidad, de modo que no parecía haber peligro inmediato. Sin embargo, cuando lo sacamos, estaba inconsciente y con la respiración irregular. Llamamos a un médico de inmediato, pero lamentablemente, no logró recuperarse. Desde entonces, todos en la casa hemos tratado de ser más cuidadosos con sus salidas nocturnas, aunque no siempre es fácil. A veces, incluso los más experimentados pueden caer en el error de subestimar sus propias capacidades. Este incidente nos ha enseñado la importancia de la precaución y la responsabilidad, especialmente en situaciones donde el alcohol puede influir en nuestras decisiones. Desde entonces, hemos establecido reglas más estrictas para asegurarnos de que no se repita.

en_results_raw: Suddenly, a sharp knock on the door broke the silence, causing Holmes to lift his head. He rose gracefully from his chair, his eyes narrowing as he approached the door. As they settled into the familiar routine of sharing the evening's events, Holmes's keen mind began to piece together the details of Watson's account, already formulating theories that would keep him occupied for days to come.

es_results_raw: Sherlock Holmes permaneció sentado durante un rato en silencio, con la cabeza inclinada hacia delante y los ojos fijos en el rojo resplandor del hogar. Su mente trabajaba a toda velocidad, analizando cada detalle de la habitación. Las sombras danzaban en las paredes, y el crujir de la madera del suelo era el único sonido en la estancia. Finalmente, Holmes levantó la vista y dirigió su mirada hacia la ventana, donde la luna iluminaba la noche con su luz plateada. Con un suspiro, se levantó y caminó hacia la chimenea, donde un pequeño objeto brillaba entre las cenizas. Con cuidado, lo recogió y lo examinó. Era un pequeño trozo de papel arrugado, pero en sus manos, Holmes sabía que podría revelar el misterio que lo había llevado hasta allí.

en_results: It is imperative that we act swiftly to avert the impending disaster. The situation is far more critical than we initially believed, and every moment wasted could
en_results_raw: It is imperative that we act swiftly to avert the impending disaster. The situation is far more critical than we initially believed, and every moment wasted could be catastrophic. Young Openshaw's cautionary advice was well-founded, and we must heed it. The blow, which has been building for years, is now poised to strike with devastating force. We must mobilize all available resources and expertise to counter this threat. Delay could mean the difference between success and failure. This is not just a matter of survival; it is a matter of preventing a catastrophe of unimaginable proportions.

en_first_half: All day I was engaged in my professional work, and it was late in the evening before I returned to Baker Street. Sherlock Holmes had not come back yet. It was nearly ten
en_second_half: o’clock before he entered, looking pale and worn. He walked up to the sideboard, and tearing a piece from the loaf he devoured it voraciously, washing it down with a long draught of water.
en_results: of the night when I finally arrived. The house was dark, save for a single light in Holmes' study. I knocked gently, but there was no answer. Concerned, I let myself in through the side door.
en_results_raw: of the night when I finally arrived. The house was dark, save for a single light in Holmes' study. I knocked gently, but there was no answer. Concerned, I let myself in through the side door. The air inside was thick with the scent of pipe smoke, though the fire had long since died down. Holmes' desk was cluttered with papers, and a half-empty bottle of brandy sat beside an open book. I called out his name, but there was no response. As I made my way upstairs, I couldn't shake the feeling that something was terribly wrong. The silence in the house was eerie, and I found myself glancing over my shoulder more than once. It wasn't until I reached the top of the stairs that I heard it—a faint sound, like a low growl. My heart raced as I approached Holmes' bedroom. The door was slightly ajar, and I pushed it open cautiously. There, on the floor, lay Sherlock Holmes, motionless. I rushed to his side, my mind racing with possibilities. What had happened to my friend? The night was far from over, and I knew I had to act quickly if I was to uncover the truth.

en_first_half: “Oh, you must not discourage me, Mr. Holmes. I know that all is well with him. There is so keen a sympathy between us that I should know if evil came upon him. On the very day that I saw him
en_second_half: last he cut himself in the bedroom, and yet I in the dining-room rushed upstairs instantly with the utmost certainty that something had happened. Do you think that I would respond to such a trifle and yet be ignorant of his death?”
en_results: , I felt a strange unease, a chill that seemed to penetrate my very soul. It was as if a shadow had fallen over him, though I had not seen him since. My heart raced with a mixture of fear and determination. I knew I had to find him,
en_results_raw: Oh, you must not discourage me, Mr. Holmes. I know that all is well with him. There is so keen a sympathy between us that I should know if evil came upon him. On the very day that I saw him, I felt a strange unease, a chill that seemed to penetrate my very soul. It was as if a shadow had fallen over him, though I had not seen him since. My heart raced with a mixture of fear and determination. I knew I had to find him, to ensure that whatever had befallen him was not permanent. The journey to his last known location was fraught with anxiety, each mile bringing me closer to the truth, yet further from the peace I craved. When I finally reached the place, the sight that greeted me was one of horror and disbelief. The house stood silent and still, its windows dark, as if it had been abandoned. But I knew better. Inside, I found him, barely alive, his body a testament to the struggle he had endured. Mr. Holmes, I whispered, my voice trembling, "What has happened to you?" His eyes, though weak, met mine with a mixture of relief and sorrow. "Watson, you must be strong. There are forces at play that you cannot yet understand. But know this, my friend, we will face them together." Those words, spoken with such conviction, gave me the strength I needed to continue the fight. Together, we would uncover the truth and bring those responsible to justice.

Những bức tường mỏng manh của tòa nhà không đủ để ngăn cách những âm thanh kinh khủng từ những sự kiện đã xảy ra trong quá khứ. Tôi không thể quên được những tiếng kêu khóc và tiếng bước chân vội vã trên hành lang. es_first_half: "Es facil para mi serlo, ya que todos los acontecimientos de aquella espantosa epoca estan grabados en mi memoria. La casa solariega es, como ya he dicho, muy antigua, y sólo un ala está ahora habitada. Las habitaciones de esta ala se encuentran en la planta baja,
es_second_half: mientras que los salones están en el bloque central de los edificios. De estos dormitorios, el primero es el del doctor Roylott, el segundo el de mi hermana y el tercero el mío. No hay comunicación entre ellos, pero todos dan al mismo pasillo. ¿Me explico bien?"
es_results: La decoración de las habitaciones es sencilla, con muebles antiguos que parecen haber sobrevivido a siglos de historia. Aunque la casa es grande, la sensación de abandono es evidente en los pasillos silenciosos y en las ventanas con cortinas desgastadas. A menudo,
es_results_raw: La decoración de las habitaciones es sencilla, con muebles antiguos que parecen haber sobrevivido a siglos de historia. Aunque la casa es grande, la sensación de abandono es evidente en los pasillos silenciosos y en las ventanas con cortinas desgastadas. A menudo, cuando la noche cae, siento una presencia extraña, como si los fantasmas de los antiguos dueños de la casa estuvieran rondando por los pasillos. He intentado explicárselo a mis amigos, pero ninguno de ellos cree en lo que he vivido. A pesar de todo, no puedo evitar sentirme atraído por la historia de esta casa, y cada vez que la visita, siento que estoy descubriendo un pedazo de la historia de mi país. A veces, incluso me pregunto si algún día podré resolver el misterio que rodea a esta antigua residencia.

en_first_half: “Away we went then, and we drove for at least an hour. Colonel Lysander Stark had said that it was only seven miles, but I should think, from the rate that we seemed to go, and from the time that we took, that it must have been nearer twelve. He sat at my side in silence all the time, and I was aware, more than once when I glanced in his direction, that he was looking at me with great intensity. The country roads seem to be not very good in that part of the world, for we lurched and jolted terribly. I tried to look out of the windows to see something of where we were, but they were made of frosted glass, and I could make out nothing save the occasional bright blur
en_second_half: of a passing light. Now and then I hazarded some remark to break the monotony of the journey, but the colonel answered only in monosyllables, and the conversation soon flagged. At last, however, the bumping of the road was exchanged for the crisp smoothness of a gravel-drive, and the carriage came to a stand. Colonel Lysander Stark sprang out, and, as I followed after him, pulled me swiftly into a porch which gaped in front of us. We stepped, as it were, right out of the carriage and into the hall, so that I failed to catch the most fleeting glance of the front of the house. The instant that I had crossed the threshold the door slammed heavily behind us, and I heard faintly the rattle of the wheels as the carriage drove away.
en_results: output>As the vehicle continued its uneven journey, the tension in the air grew palpable. Colonel Stark's silence was unnerving, and I found myself struggling to maintain my composure. The jolting motion of the car made it difficult to focus on anything but the discomfort of the ride. I tried to engage in conversation, but each attempt was met with a stern look from the colonel, a reminder that this was not a time for idle chatter.

es_first_half: "Nos fuimos entonces, y condujimos durante al menos una hora. El coronel Lysander Stark había dicho que sólo eran siete millas, pero yo creía, por la velocidad a la que parecíamos ir, y por el tiempo que tardamos, que debían ser más de doce. Se sentó a mi lado en silencio todo el tiempo, y me di cuenta, más de una vez cuando miré en su dirección, que me estaba mirando con gran intensidad. Parece que las carreteras rurales no son muy buenas en esa parte del mundo, porque dimos unos bandazos y sacudidas terribles. Intenté mirar por las ventanillas para ver algo de dónde estábamos, pero eran de vidrio esmerilado, y no pude distinguir nada más que el borrón ocasional de una luz que pasaba. De vez en
es_second_half: cuando me arriesgaba a hacer algún comentario para romper la monotonía del viaje, pero el coronel sólo respondía con monosílabos, y la conversación pronto decaía. Por fin, sin embargo, los golpes de la carretera fueron sustituidos por la crujiente suavidad de un camino de grava, y el carruaje se detuvo. El coronel Lysander Stark se bajó de él y, mientras yo lo seguía, me arrastró a un porche que se abría ante nosotros. Bajamos, por así decirlo, del carruaje y entramos en el vestíbulo, de modo que no pude echar la más fugaz mirada a la fachada de la casa. En el instante en que crucé el umbral, la puerta se cerró de golpe detrás de nosotros, y oí débilmente el traqueteo de las ruedas mientras el carruaje se alejaba."

Parece que las carreteras rurales no son muy buenas en esa parte del mundo, porque dimos unos bandazos y sacudidas terribles. Intenté mirar por las ventanillas para ver algo de dónde estábamos, pero eran de vidrio esmerilado, y no pude distinguir nada más que el borrón ocasional de una luz que pasaba. De vez en cuando, el coche se detenía bruscamente, y el coronel Stark se bajaba para inspeccionar algo en el camino. No sabía qué estaba buscando, pero su expresión era seria y concentrada. Después de cada inspección, el coche arrancaba de nuevo, y el viaje continuaba. A medida que avanzábamos, el paisaje cambió. Las casas rurales se convirtieron en edificios más grandes, y las carreteras se volvieron más transitadas. El coronel Stark seguía en silencio, pero ahora parecía más relajado. Finalmente, después de lo que parecieron horas, llegamos a un lugar que no esperaba. Era una granja, pero no como las que había visto antes. Era grande, con varias edificaciones y un gran establo. en_first_half: “It was pitch dark inside the house, and the colonel fumbled about looking for matches and muttering under his breath. Suddenly a door opened at the other end of the passage, and a long, golden bar of light shot out in our direction. It grew broader, and a woman appeared with a lamp in her hand, which she held above her head, pushing her face forward and peering at us. I could see that she was pretty, and from the gloss with which the light shone
en_second_half: upon her dark dress I knew that it was a rich material. She spoke a few words in a foreign tongue in a tone as though asking a question, and when my companion answered in a gruff monosyllable she gave such a start that the lamp nearly fell from her hand. Colonel Stark went up to her, whispered something in her ear, and then, pushing her back into the room from whence she had come, he walked towards me again with the lamp in his hand.
en_results: As the woman's face came into clearer view, I noticed the sharpness of her features and the intensity in her eyes. She wore a long, flowing dress that seemed to shimmer faintly under the lamp's glow. The colonel, still fumbling with the matches, finally struck one and held it up, illuminating the scene with a flickering light. The woman's expression shifted from curiosity to a hint of recognition, and she spoke in a voice that was both
en_results_raw: As the woman's face came into clearer view, I noticed the sharpness of her features and the intensity in her eyes. She wore a long, flowing dress that seemed to shimmer faintly under the lamp's glow. The colonel, still fumbling with the matches, finally struck one and held it up, illuminating the scene with a flickering light. The woman's expression shifted from curiosity to a hint of recognition, and she spoke in a voice that was both soft and commanding, "Colonel, what are you doing here at this hour?" The colonel, startled, stammered an explanation, but the woman cut him off, "This is not the time for explanations. We have more pressing matters to attend to." The room, which had been shrouded in darkness moments before, now seemed to hum with a sense of urgency. The woman's presence was commanding, and it was clear that she was in charge. As she moved towards a large, ornate door at the far end of the passage, the colonel followed, his movements still hesitant. The woman paused at the door, turning back to us with a look of determination. "We must act quickly," she said, her voice now tinged with urgency. "The situation is more dangerous than we initially thought." With that, she opened the door, revealing a dimly lit staircase that led to who knew where. The colonel and I exchanged a glance, and without a word, we followed her down the stairs, the lamp's light casting long shadows on the walls. The journey seemed to last an eternity, each step bringing us closer to whatever awaited us at the bottom.

El coronel, que aún sostenía las cerillas en una mano, se quedó inmóvil, como hipnotizado por la escena. La mujer, sin pronunciar una sola palabra, se detuvo a unos pasos de nosotros y, con un movimiento fluido, giró la lámpara hacia la pared, iluminando un retrato que colgaba allí. Era un retrato de un hombre de uniforme, con una expresión severa y un aire de autoridad que no pasó desapercibido para el coronel. Este último, con un suspiro, se acercó al retrato y lo estudió detenidamente, como si intentara descifrar un misterio antiguo. La mujer, impasible, observaba cada movimiento, y en ese momento, el silencio que envolvía la casa parecía más denso que nunca.

He could not fathom the sudden shift in his fortune and standing. Perhaps it was a test, a warning, or perhaps the hand of fate was simply cruel. Either way, he found himself adrift, questioning not just his actions but his very essence. The days stretched on, each one more oppressive than the last, and yet, amidst the turmoil, a small spark of hope flickered within him. Could it be that through this ordeal, he might find a deeper understanding of himself and the world around him?

en_results_raw: As I settled into my new surroundings, I felt a strange sense of disorientation. The house itself seemed to have a life of its own, with corridors that seemed to stretch endlessly and rooms that appeared to change as I walked through them. My hostess, Mrs. Fairchild, was kind but distant, and I found myself questioning the reasons for my sudden invitation to stay. The days blended together, each one bringing new mysteries and unsettling encounters. It was as if the very air at Copper Beeches was charged with secrets, and I was determined to uncover them, no matter how unsettling the truth might be. The more I delved into the past of the house and its inhabitants, the more I realized that the events I was experiencing were not just random occurrences but part of a larger, darker narrative that had been unfolding for generations. By the time I left Copper Beeches, I had not only discovered the truth but also understood the profound impact it would have on my life forever.

Vào ngày đầu tiên tôi đến trang trại Sồi Đỏ, ông Rucastle đã cho tôi một tour quanh khu vực. Ông ấy nói rằng trang trại này có lịch sử lâu đời và từng là nơi trú ẩn cho những người tị nạn. Tuy nhiên, tôi không thể nào hình dung ra tại sao một người như ông ấy lại có những câu chuyện kỳ lạ như vậy. Khi tôi hỏi về nguồn gốc của những câu chuyện, ông ấy chỉ cười và bảo rằng đó là những câu chuyện mà ông đã nghe từ ông nội của mình. Tôi không biết liệu có phải ông ấy đang cố gắng giấu đi điều gì hay không, nhưng tôi cảm thấy rằng có điều gì đó không ổn ở trang trại này. Tôi quyết định sẽ tìm hiểu thêm về những câu chuyện này và xem liệu có điều gì đáng lo ngại hay không.”

es_results_raw: continuación: En Copper Beeches, el señor Rucastle me llevó a un lugar oscuro y silencioso. Me explicó que allí había ocurrido algo terrible, pero no quiso decirme más. Durante los días siguientes, noté que los empleados evitaban mirarme directamente y que los sonidos extraños resonaban en las habitaciones. No sabía si estaba en un lugar de pesadilla o de realidad. Cada vez que intentaba hablar con alguien, me decían que no había nada de qué preocuparse. Sin embargo, en mi corazón, sentía que algo terrible estaba a punto de suceder. El ambiente en Copper Beeches era opresivo, y cada vez que salía a la luz del sol, me sentía más perdido. El señor Rucastle parecía saber más de lo que estaba dispuesto a revelar, y eso me hacía preguntarme si realmente quería saber la verdad.

tr_results_raw: Konakta karşımda duran Bay İbrahim'in yüzü ciddi ve sessizdi. "Size ne yapmam gerektiğini açıklayacağım," dedi. "Ama önce, bu olayların hepsi birbirine bağlı olduğunu fark etmek için biraz zaman almanız gerekecek." Bay İbrahim'in sözleri beni şaşırttı ve beni ilgilendirdi. "Aklınızda Akgürgenler Konağına ilk geldiğinizde ne düşünüyordunuz?" diye sordu. "Bir olay, diğerine nasıl bağlı olduğunu anlamadan bu olayları anlamak zor olabilir," dedi. Bu konu hakkında düşünmeye başladım ve Bay İbrahim'in sözlerini tekrar tekrar dinledim. Bu olayların hepsi, belki de sadece bir arada ortaya çıkıyorlardı.
